now.short: Show current time in various formats
now.long:
Display current time in various formats including Unix timestamps and common date-time formats

Supported relative time offsets:
- s: seconds (e.g., +30s, -10s)
- m: minutes (e.g., +5m, -15m)
- h: hours (e.g., +2h, -3h)
- d: days (e.g., +1d, -7d)
- w: weeks (e.g., +1w, -2w)
- M: months (e.g., +1M, -6M)
- y: years (e.g., +1y, -2y)

Examples:
  timestamp now                  # Current time
  timestamp now --offset +1d     # Tomorrow same time
  timestamp now --offset -1d     # Yesterday same time
  timestamp now --offset +1w     # Next week same time
completion.long:
Generate auto-completion script for the specified shell

Supported shells:
- bash
- zsh
- fish
- powershell

Installation:

Bash:
  timestamp completion bash > timestamp-completion.bash
  source timestamp-completion.bash

Zsh:
  timestamp completion zsh > _timestamp
  # Place in your completion directory

Fish:
  timestamp completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/timestamp.fish

PowerShell:
  timestamp completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression
flag.inputFormat: Specify input format (unix, unix-ms, unix-us, unix-ns, rfc3339, rfc3339-nano, datetime, date, time)
flag.outputFormat: Specify output format (unix, unix-ms, unix-us, unix-ns, rfc3339, rfc3339-nano, datetime, date, time)
